org.magelan.core.db
Interface DataSource

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractDataSource, DefaultDataSource, DelimitedFileDataSource, SQLDataSource, TableLinkDataSource
public interface DataSource

This interface defines a set of basic methods to operate various data sources. Such sources may be SQL tables or DBF databases as well as delimited text files. Field names and types can be obtained using the getFields() and getTypes() methods. Simple queries can be performed using the get(String, Object) and get(String, Object, String[]) methods. The query methods return Iterators of Row instances.

Version:
1.1, 09/2005
Author:
Assen Antov
See Also:
Row

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Used to obtain the name of the data source. Unlike field names the name of the data source is case sensitive. It may include spaces and special symbols.

Returns:
the name of the data source

getFields

java.lang.String[] getFields()
Returns the names of the available fields. The names are transformed to upper case. References to them are case insensitive. The exact format of field names depends on the underlying database.

Returns:
an array of the available field names

getTypes

java.lang.Class[] getTypes()
Returns the types of the available fields. The types are implementation specific. A type may be not only one of the primitive data types or their wrapper classes, but any class.

Returns:
an array of fields' types

get

java.util.Iterator get(java.lang.String field,
                       java.lang.Object value)
Returns an iterator of Row instances, representing the rows for which the parameter field is equal to the parameter value.

Parameters:
field - field to query
value - value to query
Returns:
an iterator of rows
See Also:
Row

get

java.util.Iterator get(java.lang.String field,
                       java.lang.Object value,
                       java.lang.String[] fields)
Returns an iterator of Row instances, representing the rows for which the parameter field is equal to the parameter value. The returned Row instances contain only the values of the fields referred to by the fields parameter.

Parameters:
field - field to query
value - value to query
fields - list of fields to get
Returns:
an iterator of rows
See Also:
Row

getAll

java.util.Iterator getAll()
Returns an iterator of Row instances for all records.

Returns:
an iterator of all rows
Since:
1.1
See Also:

getAll

java.util.Iterator getAll(java.lang.String[] fields)
Returns an iterator of Row instances for all records. The returned Row instances contain only the values of the fields referred to by the fields parameter.

Parameters:

Returns:

append

boolean append(java.lang.Object[] data)
Appends the parameter data to the data source.

Parameters:
data - data for the row to append
Returns:
success or failure

getFieldIndex

int getFieldIndex(java.lang.String field)
Returns the index of the parameter field.

Returns:
the index of the field or -1 if unavailable

flush

void flush()
Calling this method on the DataSource will result in permanently saving any changes made using the Row.set(int, Object), Row#set(String, Object) and Row.delete() methods. It should be expected that until such time that the method is invoked any changes to the DataSource exist only in memory. It is possible, however, that an implementation permanently saves changes immediately and does not need this method to be called. Although an implementation may occasionally perform flushes, they are generally not automatically invoked.
